actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade.
Referred to Subcommittee on Western Hemisphere Affairs.
House Committee on Foreign Affairs Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Resolution Agreed to in House by Voice Vote.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1336.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade

official_title: A concurrent resolution calling upon the President to study the advisability and practicality of a collaborative people-to-people program between the United States and Mexico.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that the President should study proposing to Mexico the establishment of a collaborative people-to-people program between Mexico and the United States. Declares that the President should explore a program which would: (1) serve as the ultimate coordinating body of collaborative programs between Mexico and the United States; (2) contribute to economic development in Mexico; (3) serve as a source of financial and technical assistance; (4) target assistance based on findings of need and take into consideration the findings of the United States-Mexican Science and Technology Mixed Commission; (5) draw extensively on and foster the development of local Mexican businesses, civic and labor organizations, and rely on private sector initiatives; and (6) rely on volunteers with skills not sufficiently available in Mexico. Urges the President to study how the program should be administered. Requests that the results of such study be transmitted to the Congress.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution calling upon the President to study the advisability and practicality of a collaborative people-to-people program between the United States and Mexico.
